anime.description: * Based on a shounen basketball manga written by http://anidb.net/cr53989 [Hinata Takeshi]. Kurumatani Sora, made a promise to his mother "I will dominate my first high school tournament". But as he joins the basketball club after entering Kuzuryuu High School, he finds out that it`s become a stomping ground for delinquents. A place where everything but basketball is done, but with Sora`s genuine zeal for basketball, things begin to stir. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: basketball
tag.description: Basketball is Netball for men, the real game that encourages dribbling and other such uncouth behaviour that was sanitised out of the ladies` version. However, it is itself woozy compared to Ulama, as the losing side are seldom publicly sacrificed.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

episode.title: みにくいあひるの子
The Ugly Duckling
Le vilain petit canard
فرخ البط القبيح
Minikui Ahiru no Ko
episode.summary: Sora is determined to join the basketball club, but the club’s members are determined to goof off instead of practice. Sora’s solution? A five-on-one game, winner takes all! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 才能のない少年達[ひとたち]
Boys Without Talent
Les garçons sans talent
صبيان بلا موهبة
Sainou no Nai Hito-tachi
episode.summary: Sora’s skill and enthusiasm remind Momoharu of what it means to be passionate about basketball — but will Momoharu keep his promise to get serious about the game again? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 百春の翼
Momoharu`s Wings
Les ailes de Momoharu
جناحا موموهارو
Momoharu no Tsubasa
episode.summary: Punks from Maru High have challenged Sora’s team to a basketball match, but how good is their team, anyway? Sora goes undercover to investigate! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 初めての飛翔
First Flight
Le premier envol
أول طيران
Hajimete no Hishou
episode.summary: The day of the match against Maru High is here, and Sora can’t wait to hit the court! But do the punks of Kuzu High stand a chance against their more experienced opponents? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 折れた翼
Broken Wings
Les ailes brisées
الجناحان المكسوران
Oreta Tsubasa
episode.summary: Tokitaka thinks he’s found a way to shut Sora out of the paint, but the pint-sized powerhouse still has a trick up his sleeve that could turn this game around! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 今しかねえ
Now`s the Time
Le moment ou jamais
الوقت المناسب
Ima Shika Nee
episode.summary: Sora’s new strategy has put him in the crosshairs of the defense, and things are looking bleak. Luckily for him, Kuzu High’s secret weapon is ready to take the court! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 迷惑な一年坊
The Troublesome Freshman
Le fauteur de troubles
طالب السنة الأولى المزعج
Meiwaku na Ichinen Bou
episode.summary: After taking an exhausted Sora home post-game, Madoka learns the truth about Sora’s basketball-star mother and the reasoning behind his grand ambitions. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アヒルとトビ
The Duck and the Kite
Le canard et Toby
آهيرو وتوبي
Ahiru to Tobi
episode.summary: Kite only cares about two things: the ball and the basket. Team bonding? He`ll pass, thanks... but will he change his tune when he learns he shares a common dream with Sora? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鳶とボールと仲間の痛み
Kite, His Ball, and the Team`s Pain
La souffrance de Toby et de l’équipe
توبي وكرته وألف رفقائه
Tobi to Hall to Nakama no Itami
episode.summary: Kite’s fate was sealed the moment he laid hands on those upperclassmen. Good thing Sora has never been one to give up without a fight. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マネージャー
Manager
L’assistante de l’équipe
المديرة
Manager
episode.summary: All Sora wanted was to get his “wings” repaired. He didn’t count on getting a super cute, super clumsy team manager in the bargain! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 男の意地と女のプライド
The Boys` Stubbornness and Girls` Pride
Ténacité masculine et fierté féminine
عناد الشباب وكبرياء الفتيات
Otoko no Iji to Onna no Pride
episode.summary: Winning the match against the girls’ team should be a piece of cake, but Nao’s tactical abilities — not to mention the value of teamwork — shouldn’t be taken lightly. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: TEAM
Team
Team
فريق
Team
episode.summary: When Nao abruptly resigns as manager, Sora learns that there is more to her basketball background than meets the eye. Later, the need for team funds rears its expensive head. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 温度の違い
Differing Enthusiasm
Une différence d’ambition
حماس متباين
Ondo no Chigai
episode.summary: True passion for the game drives players like Sora to succeed. But can passion for basketball be taught — especially to players still new to the sport? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 勝利に向かって
Towards Victory
En route vers la victoire
نحو النصر
Shouri ni Mukatte
episode.summary: It’s hard to stay motivated when the inter-high tournament is so far away, but Nao has a plan to keep the team on its toes. First item on the agenda: learning how to screen! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 男の心意気
The Boys` Spirit
L’entrain des garçons
همة الرجال
Otoko no Kokoroiki
episode.summary: The players of Kuzu High have just one practice game to prove they’re worth taking seriously. Has their training camp paid off, or will Kitasumi High dominate the court? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最高の始まりと最悪の始まり
The Best Start and the Worst Start
Le meilleur et le pire départ
أفضل بداية وأسوأ بداية
Saikou no Hajimari to Saiaku no Hajimari
episode.summary: As Kitasumi High gets serious, Nao unveils Kuzu High’s super secret defense strategy. It’s time to knock out the competition — and Sora is the key to victory! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: バーサス
Versus
Versus
مواجهة
Versus
episode.summary: Although guarding Taro is exhausting, Sora’s intense eyes make it clear that he’s ready to face the challenge head on! But can Chucky say the same when he takes to the court? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 今.....
Now...
Et maintenant...
الآن
Ima.....
episode.summary: With Sora on the sidelines, Tobi becomes the target of Kitasumi High’s latest defense strategy: the insidious 2-2-1 zone press! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 誰よりも高く
Higher Than Anyone
Plus haut que quiconque
أعلى من أيّ شخص آخر
Dare yori mo Takaku
episode.summary: Dedication. Perseverance. Commitment. These are the qualities that make a basketball champion — and thanks to Konishi, Momoharu isn’t sure if he possesses any of them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ラストプレイ
Last Play
La dernière action
الهجمة الأخيرة
Last Play
episode.summary: As Sora steps into the role of pointguard, Chiaki steps into the spotlight. The fate of the game hangs in the balance, but will their change-up lead to victory or defeat? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 涙
Tears
Larmes
دموع
Namida
episode.summary: A final shot will decide the fate of the match against Kitasumiyoshi High. As the dust settles, Madoka makes a difficult decision. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ラストピース
The Last Piece
La pièce manquante
القطعة الأخيرة
Last Piece
episode.summary: The school basketball tournament pits teammate against teammate. As Sora and Tobi face off, a towering new player steps onto the court. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 月とリング
The Moon and the Hoop
La lune et le cerceau
القمر والحلق
Tsuki to Ring
episode.summary: Mokichi’s height gives him an undisputed advantage on the court, but when it comes to basketball, height alone can’t outpace the pressure of lofty expectations. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 光
Light
La lumière
ضوء
Hikari
episode.summary: Midterms have arrived, and the team will have to hit the books if they all want to enter the tournament preliminaries. Meanwhile, Madoka makes a shocking discovery… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 埋もれた才能
Undiscovered Talent
Le talent caché
موهبة غير مكتشفة
Umoreta Sainou
episode.summary: After a sleepless night, the first match of the tournament has arrived! But Kuzu High isn’t the only team pinning their dreams on this game… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: RUSH AND RUSH
Rush and Rush
Rush and Rush
عجلة وعجلة
Rush and Rush
episode.summary: Hobble a key player, and the entire team will fall apart. Chiaki learns this lesson the hard way when the players of Shinjo High render his passing abilities obsolete. Source: crunchyroll
